author: Nicole Ogrysko
title: Shipping, boating industries ask for delay in ship speed limits aimed at protecting right whales | Maine Public
text: Shipping, boating industries ask for delay in ship speed limits aimed at protecting right whales Conservation groups said they're waiting on the federal government to finalize long-delayed ship speed limits, which are aimed at preventing collisions with critically endangered North Atlantic right whales. But industry groups are now asking Congress for a five-year delay. The new speed rules [were proposed](https://www.mainepublic.org/environment-and-outdoors/2022-07-29/nautical-speed-limits-proposed-to-help-protect-right-whales-from-ship-strikes) by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) nearly two years ago. Since then, the outdoor recreation and maritime shipping industries have argued that new speed restrictions would harm their businesses. "Imagine owning a 45-foot vessel and desiring to fish offshore, typically 80 to 90 miles, and being restricted to 10 knots," said Jeff Strong with the Marine Retailers Association of the Americas. "Our clients will not do this. They will sell their boats and create significant job losses." The industries are advocating for [new federal legislation](https://naturalresources.house.gov/uploadedfiles/hearing_memo_--_sub_on_wwf_leg_hrg_on_4_bills_06.27.24.pdf) that would delay the implementation until at least 2030 and instead establish a grant program to deploy technologies aimed at reducing right whale vessel strikes. Jessica Redfern, a scientist and associate vice president of the Anderson Cabot Center for Ocean Life at the New England Aquarium acknowledged that new technology may help boaters detect right whales in real time. But she said that will take time to test, and with a population of fewer than 350 right whales, the species can't afford to wait. "The aquarium is committed to working with our partners to find technological solutions," Redfern said Thursday during a U.S. congressional hearing on the proposed legislation. "We just have to make sure right whales survive for long enough to benefit from those technologies." At least three right whales have been killed by ships within the last year, Redfern said. Another has died due to an [entanglement in Maine fishing gear](https://www.mainepublic.org/environment-and-outdoors/2024-02-14/rope-removed-from-right-whale-found-dead-last-month-was-from-maine-noaa-says). NOAA has [reported](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/national/endangered-species-conservation/north-atlantic-right-whale-updates#calf-of-right-whale-skittle-(3260)-presumed-dead) that at least four right whale calves have gone missing so far in 2024 and are presumed dead because they've lost contact with their mothers. NOAA, for its part, said during Thursday's congressional hearing that it also opposes legislation that will delay ship speed rules, though it's unclear what exactly is holding up the agency from finalizing them. Congress has already [approved a pause](https://www.mainepublic.org/environment-and-outdoors/2022-12-20/maines-federal-lawmakers-get-reprieve-for-lobstermen-in-national-spending-bill) on new rules aimed at reducing the risks of fishing gear entanglement on right whales through 2028.

organizations.name: marine retailers association of the americas

author: Aline Nicolas
title: Cazzu dedica conmovedoras palabras a su hija con Nodal, Inti, y publica FOTOS inéditas | El Heraldo de México
text: No tiene ni un año de edad, pero ya es la sensación de países como México y Argentina, de donde son originarios sus papás. Nos referimos a Inti, la hija de Cazzu y [Christian Nodal](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/espectaculos/2024/4/12/la-sorprendente-cifra-que-christian-nodal-habria-desembolsado-para-borrar-sus-tatuajes-593867.html), quien durante sus primeros meses de vida permaneció en el anonimato para proteger su privacidad; sin embargo, más tarde la pareja tomó la decisión de presumirle al mundo entero la carita de su primogénita. Desde entonces no han parado y en cada oportunidad que tienen la presumen ante sus millones de fans. Aunque los lujos a los que está expuesta la hija de los cantantes de regional mexicano y trap suelen ser los grandes protagonistas, en esta ocasión, la intérprete argentina compartió unas conmovedoras palabras a su hija. Aquí te contamos todos los detalles y además te revelamos las fotos más recientes de la bebita más querida del mundo del espectáculo. Sigue leyendo: [Christian Nodal comparte la selfie en el espejo más tierna junto a su hija Inti: FOTO](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/espectaculos/2024/4/17/christian-nodal-comparte-la-selfie-en-el-espejo-mas-tierna-junto-su-hija-inti-foto-595058.html) [Nodal e Inti: el cantante presume una nueva fotografía de su hija, así lucieron](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/espectaculos/2024/4/13/nodal-inti-el-cantante-presume-una-nueva-fotografia-de-su-hija-asi-lucieron-593991.html) Cazzu comparte fotos desde el estudio con Inti y conmueve con sus palabras Por medio de su cuenta de Instagram, donde la "Nena Trampa" acumula más de 13 millones de seguidores, compartió nuevas fotos junto a su bebé en las que dejó claro que ella es su flechazo más grande. Pues además de la mirada de amor maternal que le suele dedicar a Inti, hoy también agregó un bonito mensaje que demuestra que vive el mejor momento de su vida. "Que me saquen todo menos vos", fueron las breves, pero conmovedoras palabras con las que la novia de Nodal conquistó las redes sociales. En las fotos que causaron sensación en redes sociales se observa a Cazzu en el estudio de grabación con un look muy relajado y nada alejado de su estilo urbano. Además, se le ve sentada en el piso, donde su bebé descansa sobre una cobijita mientras juega con su mamá; asimismo, en otras tomas se le ve atenta a la música que ya se estaría creando en el lugar. Como era de esperarse, la sección de comentarios se llenó de fans emocionados que no dejan de celebrar al fruto que la trapera y Nodal tuvieron, pues Inti se ha ganado el título de ser la más tierna. Por otro lado, en las opiniones, algunos seguidores demostraron que están emocionados por el pronto regreso de la cantante a la industria de la música. "Nosotrxs la cuidamos pero jefa saca música por fa, las amo", "su mini Nodal", "Cazzu te extrañamos, nosotros y Nodal te cuidamos a Inti" y "bellas" son algunos de los comentarios que recibió la cantante en su última publicación en redes sociales.

author: sina.com.cn
title: 雅迪电动车也有百度地图导航了：支持红绿灯倒计时_新浪科技_新浪网
text:
快科技4月3日消息，雅迪电动车宣布，携手百度地图重磅开启两轮车智能导航新时代。
据了解，双方打造了组合屏全景投屏导航， 双屏协同显示，主屏呈现骑行数据与车辆状态，副屏显示全景导航信息。
它还实现了行业首个在组合屏实时显示路口红绿灯倒计时功能 ，可精准预判通行时间，提升通勤效率。
而且提供三种导航样式，背景可选深色和浅色，并支持简易导航。
后续车型推出以下功能：
-动态车道指引：根据实时路况推荐最优车道，减少变道频次，提升骑行安全。
-车道级导航：基于高精地图数据，精准识别车道线，避免误入禁行区域，尤其适用于多车道复杂路段。
-转向路口放大指引：在接近转弯或匝道时，屏幕自动放大路口实景图，结合箭头光效提示，降低错行概率。
【本文结束】如需转载请务必注明出处：快科技
责任编辑：随心

author: Programme TV
title: Sciences Po: Mathias Vicherat devra se déporter des sujets liés aux violences sexuelles et sexistes
text:
AFP Sciences Po: Mathias Vicherat devra se déporter des sujets liés aux violences sexuelles et sexistes AFP 26 janvier 2024 à 0:14 AM Le directeur de Sciences Po, Mathias Vicherat, le 28 mars 2022 à Paris (Thomas SAMSON)
Mathias Vicherat, qui réintègrera lundi ses fonctions de directeur de L'Institut d'études politiques de Paris (Sciences Po), devra se déporter des sujets liés aux violences sexuelles et sexistes, après avoir été entendu en décembre par la police dans une enquête pour violences conjugales, a-t-on appris jeudi de source proche.
La commission qui rassemble les bureaux des différents conseils de Sciences Po (conseil d'administration, de l'institut, de la vie étudiante et de la formation, scientifique), qui a validé le retour de M. Vicherat pour le 29 janvier, a communiqué jeudi en interne sur les conditions de ce retour.
Dans un message adressé aux étudiants et personnels, dont l'AFP a obtenu copie, cette commission estime que la mise en garde à vue de Mathias Vicherat "a été dommageable pour Sciences Po et pour toutes les personnes qui y travaillent et y étudient".
Elle "demande" que le directeur "puisse s'exprimer dans les meilleurs délais devant les CA (conseil d'administration) et CI (conseil de l'institut) pour présenter les dispositions qu'il mettra en oeuvre afin de reconstruire cette confiance".
"Lorsque l'enquête préliminaire sera close, le directeur se présentera devant les deux instances (CA et CI), afin de savoir s'il dispose toujours de leur confiance", poursuit le message.
"Jusqu'à cette date, la commission invite le directeur à prendre, dans le respect du code de l'éducation, les dispositions administratives nécessaires pour traiter les questions liées aux VSS (violences sexuelles et sexistes)", indique le message.
Selon une source proche, sollicitée par l'AFP, cela signifie que "Mathias Vicherat va devoir se déporter des sujets liés aux VSS".
Peu après son arrivée à la tête de Science Po fin 2021, il avait décrété comme "priorité absolue" la lutte contre ces violences.
Un conseil de l'institut exceptionnel est prévu mardi midi, ainsi qu'un conseil d'administration exceptionnel mercredi après-midi, selon des sources concordantes.
Lire la suite Le retour du directeur de Sciences Po pourrait être perturbé par une mobilisation d'étudiants, qui avaient dès le départ demandé sa démission et manifesté devant l'établissement.
"La mobilisation étudiante se poursuivra jusqu'à sa démission", a écrit jeudi dans un communiqué le syndicat Union étudiante de Sciences Po.
Mathias Vicherat et son ex-compagne Anissa Bonnefont, qui s'accusaient réciproquement de violences conjugales, ont été placés en garde à vue le 3 décembre avant d'être remis en liberté le lendemain. Une enquête préliminaire a été ordonnée par le parquet de Paris.
asm/alu/swi
TENDANCE L'ancienne championne de judo Maricet Espinosa est morte à 34 ans dans des circonstances tragiques Programme TV Kate Middleton opérée et hospitalisée longuement, un expert médical peu rassurant : "Il s'agit de quelque chose de sérieux" Purepeople Kate Middleton hospitalisée : "A son âge, ce serait étonnant", l’avis d’un gynécologue sur le mal dont elle souffre Closer Anny Duperey pousse un coup de gueule sur l'affaire Gérard Depardieu : "Il faut quand même différencier la part artistique et la part humaine" Programme TV Personne ne l'avait vu venir : ce film français explose tout sur Netflix, même les gros films d'action américains s'inclinent Purebreak

author: Timothy Cerullo
title: Kenya Met Lists Nairobi & Mombasa Among 5 Regions to Receive Rainfall Over Next 5 Days
text: The Kenya Meteorological Department on Saturday cautioned Kenyans to brace for occasional rainfall over the next five days starting October 12 to October October 16. In its five-day advisory, the weather department urged the residents living in the regions of the Highlands East, the West of the Rift Valley, the Lake Victoria Basin, the Rift Valley and the Coast to prepare for moderate to heavy rainfall. According to the Meteorological Department, the counties of Nyandarua, Laikipia, Nyeri, Kirinyaga, Murang'a, Kiambu, Meru, Embu, Tharaka and Nairobi are set to receive moderate rainfall over the next five days. Kenya Met revealed that rainfall in the above counties will begin in the afternoon and extend through the night hours. However, rainfall in some of the counties was projected to begin in the morning. The counties of Siaya, Kisumu, Homabay, Migori, Kisii, Nyamira, Trans Nzoia, Baringo, Uasin Gishu and Elgeyo-Marakwet were projected to experience heavy rains from Saturday through to Wednesday, October 16. Other counties set to receive heavy rains; include; Nandi, Nakuru, Narok, Kericho, Bomet, Kakamega, Vihiga, Bungoma, Busia and West Pokot. Kenya Met in its advisory disclosed that the heavy rains expected in the above counties will be accompanied by thunderstorms. The rains will be experienced in the afternoon and extend to the night. Similarly, the Coastal counties of Mombasa, Kilifi, Lamu and Kwale Counties as well as parts of Tana River County were expected to experience light rains, particularly in the morning hours. However, the rains were projected to extend to noon. Temperature Advisory Kenya Met in its weekly advisory also cautioned Kenyans of very cold night temperatures specifically in the counties of Nyandarua, Laikipia, Nyeri, Kirinyaga, Murang'a, Kiambu, Meru, Embu, Tharaka, and Nairobi. According to the Meteorological Department, the night[ temperatures in the above counties were expected to drop to 5°C ](https://www.kenyans.co.ke/news/105007-kenya-met-issues-weekend-rainfall-advisory-5-regions-including-nairobi-mombasa)in the first three days of the forecast before rising to 7°C and 8°C for the rest of the days. Similarly, residents living in Siaya, Kisumu, Homabay, Migori, Kisii, Nyamira, Trans Nzoia, Baringo, Uasin Gishu, Elgeyo-Marakwet were cautioned to brace for high daytime temperatures of up to 35°C. Other counties that were cautioned to prepare for hot days include; Marsabit, Mandera, Wajir, Garissa, Isiolo, Mombasa, Tana River, Kilifi, Lamu and Kwale.

author: ArcaMax Publishing, Inc.
title: Justice Department agencies have warned of budget cut fallout
text:
Justice Department agencies have warned of budget cut fallout
Published in
[News & Features](/currentnews/newsheadlines/)
WASHINGTON — House Republicans proposed another round of funding cuts to the Justice Department this week, despite warnings from agency officials that past cutbacks are hampering their law enforcement and public safety work.
House appropriators rolled out a draft fiscal 2025 Commerce-Justice-Science spending bill that would slash funds for the DOJ and several of its entities that got reductions in the previous fiscal year, including the FBI and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives.
ATF Director Steven Dettelbach, whose agency got a $47 million cut to its salary and expenses account in the current fiscal year, has said that he had to cancel three new special agent classes, which he said would have equated to about 10 to 12 fully staffed squads of agents.
The fiscal 2025 spending bill would cut that agency account by a further $188.5 million, according to a Republican summary.
“The president has again called on Congress to fully fund ATF,” Dettelbach said at an event Tuesday in Ohio. “Yet, unfortunately, just this morning, the House of Representatives released a plan to impose even further, deeper, more damaging cuts on ATF.”
Biden administration officials have told lawmakers in recent months that they are wading through the reverberations of the fiscal 2024 cuts, which Republican lawmakers secured in a negotiated spending package that cleared Congress earlier this year.
U.S. attorney offices, which prosecute federal crimes, would see an 11% cut in fiscal 2025 under the Republican-backed bill. Funding for those offices was virtually kept even last fiscal year, but they are feeling the pinch.
Adam Hanna, vice president of policy and advocacy at National Association of Assistant U.S. Attorneys, said they’ve heard from members that their offices are not being authorized to fill vacancies, particularly in legal support roles, and that they may have to live with unfilled positions until further notice.
The fiscal 2025 spending bill would cut the FBI’s funding by 3.5%. In April, FBI Director Christopher Wray said the agency’s fiscal 2024 budget was about $500 million less than what the agency needed to sustain its 2023 efforts.
“It’s about a $500 million cut in our ability to get our job done,” he told lawmakers.
...continued

author: archyde
title: Enhancing Wellness: Strategies to Counteract Stress and Promote Well-being with Palladium Hotel Group
text:
2024-04-04 21:33:01
This year, the theme of
World Health Day is “My health, my right.” Without a doubt, elected to defend that all people have access to quality health services, education and information, among others. Thus, and with the intention of enhancing the growing trend of physical and mental care for all people: awareness about stress and its consequences on health is becoming more and more relevant.
According to the Global Wellness Institute (GWI), the global wellness
economy is worth $4.4 trillion and is projected to reach $7 trillion by 2025. These figures are not surprising, as people look for options to prioritize their health, this is because 48% of Latin Americans feel stressed daily in their work environment, according to Health on Demand 2023, a report launched by the consultancy Marsh McLennan. Furthermore, within the top 10 countries with the highest levels of stress in the region is Peru in third place and Colombia in eighth, according to The State of Work 2023 from the Gallup consultancy. Against this backdrop, Palladium Hotel Group joins the cause and shares three activities to counteract stress, prioritize rest and achieve well-being of body and mind.
Restorative massages
According to the Mayo Clinic, massages or massage therapy are an auxiliary to comprehensive medicine, which is why they provide multiple benefits for those who receive them, including: stress reduction, reduction of pain in any mild or serious condition, elimination of muscle tension, strengthening the immune system, relaxation, among others.
Among the many options are Swedish massages, one of the most used techniques to balance the body naturally, with soft or strong movements throughout the body, but always in the opposite direction of blood circulation. According to the European Parasanitary School, these types of techniques reduce joint pain, promote the elimination of toxins, in addition to helping blood circulation.
Most spas usually offer hydrotherapy circuits, this technique consists of performing movements or activities within an aquatic environment, be it a pool or a jacuzzi. In fact, according to TELETON USA, hydrotherapy helps in increasing strength, improving awareness, improving mobility, as well as increasing balance and promoting better blood circulation.
Palladium Hotel Group’s wellness centres, Zentropia Palladium Spa & Wellness, feature all of the above options and are located at Grand Palladium Hotels & Resorts, TRS Hotels and Family Selection at Grand Palladium Hotels & Resorts. Specifically, Punta Cana, Cap Cana, Riviera Maya, Costa Mujeres, Vallarta and even Ibiza are some of the destinations where guests can live an unparalleled experience.
With modern facilities that include a jacuzzi, sauna, professional massages, facials and even vegan treatments that are performed with views of the Caribbean, the Palladium Hotel Group spas are a relaxing oasis with dream locations set with interior design designed in accordance with the local culture. , as well as personalized attention to de-stress in the middle of nature.
Natural landscapes
The ocean has been shown to have multiple
health benefits. For example, the book by marine biologist, Wallace J. Nichols entitled Blue Mind, highlights the properties that seawater has on people; from helping relaxation, reducing stress and promoting reflection. Furthermore, in the physical sphere, research from the Japan School of Medicine revealed that salt in seawater is an ally in curing dermatological conditions.
That is why taking vacations in a beach destination can be a great option, especially if you reserve in places specifically focused on well-being, such is the case of Mexico and the Dominican Republic, places that occupy the first positions in Latin America with options for practice wellness tourism in Caribbean regions. In addition, activities such as Sunrise Yoga with sea views certainly make a difference, or the water sports offered at Palladium Hotel Group resorts, such as Kayaking or enjoying sailing with a HobbieCat.
Practice sports
According to the Mayo Clinic, exercise, in any form, can help relieve stress. So staying active can increase levels of feel-good endorphins and distract you from your daily worries.
In this sense, the Zentropia Palladium Spa & Wellness centers have a gym equipped with the latest equipment, a beauty salon, a facial service, as well as other treatments, which complement the offer for a comprehensive trip in which well-being is protagonist. In addition to this, this sports and fitness offer can be completed with sports practices such as mini-golf, tennis, paddle tennis, pickleball or the fantastic training clinics at the Rafael Nadal Tennis Center in Costa Mujeres, and other activities more focused on well-being such as stretching. sunrise or yoga classes with sea views.
Both TRS Hotels, Family Selection at Grand Palladium Hotels & Resorts and Gran Palladium Hotels & Resort allow moments that promote
health and relaxation, to achieve the well-being of the entire family, with a varied range of services in dream destinations.

author: Wade Littleton Tribune Staff Writer
title: Weather affecting Food on Foot distribution | Local News | citizentribune.com
text:
The cold and snowy weather has prevented Food on Foot from getting food to the Hamblen County Schools students due to school being out.
Founder/President Carolyn Jarnagin said that it breaks her heart knowing that some students who depend on the weekend food bags have been doing without.
“We have a heart for these kids,” Jarnagin said. “We have had to cancel the weekend food bags due to schools being out.”
Two weeks ago when the Polar Vortex wreaked havoc on the Lakeway Area, the bags were distributed on Wednesday due to inclement weather that week.
Jarnagin has been unable to get to the 1 Berkline Drive location due to back roads being slick and icy.
“We have a heart for the kids having to be at home and not getting their free lunches and breakfasts,” Jarnagin said. “We were going to distribute the bags Wednesday, but school was out.
“It breaks our hearts not to be able to take the weekend bags to the students,” Jarnagin said. “We’re deeply saddened that we were unable to distribute the bags.”
Since Food on Foot began almost 18 years ago, support has grown to the point where 657 students across 17 Hamblen County schools receive the weekend bags. Food on Foot can’t continue this work without the support of local churches, volunteers and businesses.
According to October, 2023 data from the U.S. Census Bureau’s Household Pulse Survey, one in every eight American adults are struggling to afford enough food.
Nearly 28 million adults nationwide — 12.5% of the adult population — were living in homes where there was either sometimes or often not enough to eat in the last week.
This is the highest that figure has reached since the first year of the COVID-19 pandemic.
The survey indicated that 3.0% of American adults “often” did not have enough to eat in the last week and 9.5% “sometimes” did not have enough food that October.
Another 33.8% reported having enough food, but not always the kinds they wanted, while 53.7% could afford and access the kinds of food they wanted at all times.
The USDA food security as access to enough food for an active, healthy life for all members of a household. According to the department, a household is considered food secure if it can eat an adequately nutritious diet without resorting to using emergency food supplies, scavenging, stealing, or other measures.
The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) identifies four general levels of food security from high to very low. Children in households with very low food security may have to skip meals or go a whole day without eating due to limited money or resources.
Conversely, everyone in a food secure household has consistent access to healthy meals and no one worries about affording groceries or running out of food. The USDA provides nutritional support to Americans through a host of programs, including Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). SNAP participation increased from 37.1 million in January, 2020 to 41.4 million in October, 2023.
To support Food on Foot’s mission to feed the hungry, mail a check to P. O. Box 2129, Morristown, TN 37816. Call 865-566-5778.
